name: MORALE-BOOSTING MEAL
description: The Exalt creates or orchestrates a shared meal, instilling unity and vigor. Spend 2 motes. If taken as a Craft Charm, the Exalt prepares the food. As an Embassy Charm, they guide conversation and setting. All who partake may either double 9s on a roll of their choice or start the next combat with 1 Power.

modes.name: Alchemical
modes.title: Shared Network
modes.effect: Alchemicals sharing the meal may reflexively exchange Charms as per the Rite of Reconfiguration or reflexively gain an Evocation on an ally’s artifact that also shared the meal.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Sweeten-the-Tap Method
modes.effect: Applies to libations. The Dragon-Blood and her Hearthmates double 9s on social influence actions for the rest of the scene.

modes.name: Liminal
modes.title: Stirring Memorial Banquet
modes.effect: Anyone partaking doubles 9s on social influence actions involving the emotions matching the Liminal’s passive anima for the scene.

modes.name: Infernal
modes.title: Poison the Well
modes.effect: The Infernal chooses two targets at the meal and doubles 9s on social actions increasing enmity between them for the scene.

name: CLOAKING THE WORKMAN'S TOUCH
description: Through finesse and Essence, the Exalt can conceal her workmanship. Spend 1 mote. Anyone examining the item suffers +3 difficulty on rolls to detect whether the item is crafted or how it was constructed. If used on an item also affected by Flawless Counterfeit Technique, this penalty becomes difficulty 8.

name: FLAWLESS COUNTERFEIT TECHNIQUE
description: Spend 1 mote to create an exact replica of a mundane item after a dramatic scene of study and crafting. The duplicate is visually indistinguishable and requires a difficulty 7 roll to detect. At Essence 2, the Exalt may infuse matching Essence, requiring a flawless magical detection to succeed instead.

name: CLEVER IMPROVISATION METHOD
description: Allows the Exalt to conjure a temporary tool from available materials without a roll, spending 1 mote. The tool exists only for the duration of the task and breaks after use unless Stunt dice are used to extend its life or enhance materials.

modes.name: Alchemical
modes.title: Efficient Improvisation of Materials
modes.effect: Adds gears and metal to the item. May use it up to the Exalt’s Essence additional times.

modes.name: Liminal
modes.title: Contributions of Flesh
modes.effect: Adds sinew, bone, or hair to the item. May use it up to the Exalt’s Essence additional times.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Many-Hands Technique
modes.effect: If using Hearthmate components, the item lasts until the next major milestone.

name: QUICKENING THE FORGE
description: Reduces the time scale of crafting ventures by one step while 2 motes are committed.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Supreme Perfection of Style
modes.effect: Select one craft type; reduce time scale by two steps, minimum once per scene. Gain more specialties at Essence 3/5.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Blazing Dragon-Smith Arete
modes.effect: Double time reduction when working with elemental materials based on Aspect.

modes.name: Lunar
modes.title: Inchoate Wonders Realized
modes.effect: Transforms raw materials into a usable illusionary item. The fake collapses at story’s end unless completed.

name: SUDDEN TRAP ATTACK
description: Spend 1 mote. Creates or retroactively declares a one-use trap within medium range. Traps are treated as difficulty 3–5 hazards and may cause damage or immobilize targets. Roll to escape or break free. Resettable only by successful use.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Bone-and-Sinew Contraption
modes.effect: Traps made from or hidden within corpses; if hidden, increase trap difficulty by one.

name: TERRAIN-ALTERING ADVANTAGE
description: Spend 1 mote on Step 1. The Exalt manipulates nearby objects or elements into environmental hazards or difficult terrain using a prepare Build Power roll with two bonus successes. These effects last one round, sustained by spending Power.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Elemental Fury
modes.effect: Add elemental effects to hazard. Extends duration to Essence in rounds and increases damage by 1.

name: DURABILITY-ENHANCING PROCEDURE
description: Spend 2 motes during crafting. The item becomes resistant to wear and time: Increase damage/breaking difficulty by Exalt’s Essence (min 3), and lifespan increases tenfold (e.g., food doesn’t spoil, weapons don’t dull).

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Eternal Embalming Preparation
modes.effect: May embalm corpses against decay permanently.

name: EFFICIENT CRAFTING TECHNIQUE
description: Spend 1 mote to reduce penalties (by 3) caused by insufficient tools or workspaces during a crafting venture.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Artisan Needs No Tools
modes.effect: Waives all workspace/tool penalties at Essence 2.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Stone-Carving Fingers
modes.effect: May craft earthen materials barehanded without penalties.

name: WONDER-CRAFTING INITIATION
description: Allows crafting of artifacts. Spend 1 mote per obstacle roll in such projects. Requires a dramatic scene apprenticing to a mentor. May also be used to build manses if the character has adequate geomantic knowledge or hearthstone reference.

modes.name: Solar
modes.title: Strengthening Touch
modes.effect: Spend 1 mote when finishing an item to increase its destruction difficulty by 3 and add one obstacle to feats of strength to destroy it.

modes.name: Abyssal
modes.title: Ruin Resurrection Method
modes.effect: Spend 1 mote while repairing. Automatically overcomes an Excessively Damaged obstacle (difficulty up to 3). Can reconstruct from destroyed fragments.

modes.name: Dragon-Blooded
modes.title: Follow the Dragons
modes.effect: Through innate resonance with dragon lines, spend 1 mote while making an obstacle roll to build an elemental manse (p. 158). Whoever bears the hearthstone in an artifact may add an elemental-related effect to the hearthstone’s inherent property. For example: reducing environmental damage from magical fire-based hazards by two.
